Name: Aged Rum
Description: Oak-aged rum with vanilla, spice, and dried fruit notes, bridges rum and whiskey profiles

Name: Aquavit
Description: Nordic spirit flavored with caraway and dill, savory and polarizing

Name: Armagnac
Description: Rustic grape brandy with heavier body and less polish than cognac

Name: Baijiu (Light Aroma)
Description: Light-aroma Chinese baijiu with high volatility and estery lift

Name: Bourbon
Description: American whiskey with vanilla, caramel, and oak dominance

Name: Calvados
Description: Apple-based brandy with fresh fruit acidity and oxidative notes

Name: Cognac
Description: Aged grape brandy with elegance and rounded aromatics

Name: Dark Rum
Description: Molasses-forward rum with rich caramel and spice notes

Name: Gin
Description: Botanical-driven spirit, dry and aromatic, emphasizes clarity, structure, and definition

Name: Irish Whiskey
Description: Triple-distilled whiskey, smooth, soft, and approachable with low edge

Name: Japanese Whisky
Description: Refined whisky style emphasizing balance, subtlety, and precision over power

Name: London Dry Gin
Description: Classic dry-style gin with dominant juniper and restrained sweetness, high structural discipline

Name: Mezcal
Description: Smoky agave spirit with strong identity and mineral depth

Name: Navy Strength Gin
Description: High-proof gin with amplified botanicals and alcohol intensity

Name: Overproof Rum
Description: Extremely high-proof rum, volatile and aggressive, used in small quantities for lift

Name: Pisco
Description: Unaged grape brandy, floral and expressive, highly reactive with citrus

Name: Rye Whiskey
Description: Dry and spicy whiskey with sharp aromatic edges

Name: Scotch Whisky
Description: Malt-forward whisky ranging from floral to heavily peated

Name: Shochu
Description: Low-proof Japanese spirit, restrained aroma, high drinkability

Name: Soju
Description: Neutral, low-proof Korean spirit, minimal flavor impact

Name: Tequila Blanco
Description: Unaged agave spirit, bright, vegetal, and acid-reactive

Name: Vodka
Description: Neutral spirit with minimal aroma, used to suppress base flavor and highlight modifiers

Name: White Rum
Description: Light-bodied rum with subtle sweetness and high mixability

Name: Agave Syrup
Description: Clean, rounded sweetness; pairs naturally with agave spirits.

Name: Amaro
Description: Herbal bitter-sweet liqueur with digestive depth

Name: Amaro (General)
Description: Herbal bitter-sweet family; adds medicinal depth and long finish.

Name: Amontillado Sherry
Description: Oxidative sherry; nutty depth, bridges dry and rich styles.

Name: Angostura Bitters
Description: Highly concentrated bitters used for structure correction

Name: Aperol
Description: Gentler aperitivo; orange-forward sweetness with mild bitterness.

Name: Bianco Vermouth
Description: White, semi-sweet vermouth; soft floral sweetness without heavy caramel notes.

Name: Campari
Description: Iconic bitter; red-fruit bitterness that creates strong tension and memory.

Name: Celery Bitters
Description: Savory-green accent; sharpens savory cocktails and cuts sweetness.

Name: Chartreuse (Herbal Liqueur)
Description: High-intensity alpine herbs; turns simple structures into signature drinks.

Name: Chocolate Bitters
Description: Cacao bitterness; deepens brown-spirit drinks with dessert tension.

Name: Curacao
Description: Orange liqueur with deeper peel/spice notes than typical triple sec.

Name: Dry Vermouth
Description: Fortified wine; adds dryness, herb lift, and structure (Martini backbone).

Name: Elderflower Liqueur
Description: Floral sweetness; makes drinks immediately approachable and aromatic.

Name: Fernet
Description: Intense bitter-mint profile; polarizing, high-impact accent or rinse.

Name: Fino Sherry
Description: Very dry sherry; saline, bready, sharpens finish and adds savory elegance.

Name: Gentian Bitter (Suze-style)
Description: Bright, rooty bitterness; lifts aromatics without heavy sweetness.

Name: Grenadine (Pomegranate Syrup)
Description: Fruity-tart sweetness; adds color and nostalgic profile (best when real).

Name: Honey Syrup
Description: Floral sweetness; adds warmth and gentle complexity.

Name: Maraschino Liqueur
Description: Cherry-pit almondy sweetness; small dose adds lift and perfume.

Name: Orange Bitters
Description: Citrus bitters; brightens martinis/old-fashioneds without adding sugar.

Name: Peychaud's Bitters
Description: Anise-cherry bitters; adds perfumed sweetness illusion and color.

Name: Rich Syrup (2:1)
Description: Denser sweetness; adds body and smoother mouthfeel.

Name: Simple Syrup (1:1)
Description: Baseline sweetener; raises drinkability and reduces perceived acidity.

Name: Sweet Vermouth
Description: Fortified wine; sweet-herbal depth, rounds edges (Negroni/Manhattan core).

Name: Triple Sec
Description: Orange liqueur providing sweetness and citrus lift

Name: Triple Sec (Orange Liqueur)
Description: Orange sweetness + citrus oil; classic sweetener/bridge in sours.

Name: Grapefruit Juice
Description: Bitter-citrus acidity; adds grown-up brightness and dry finish.

Name: Lemon Juice
Description: Clean acidity; slightly softer than lime, very versatile.

Name: Lime Juice
Description: High-acid; sharp, bright, drives classic sour structures.

Name: Orange
Description: Sweet citrus providing aroma and roundness

Name: Orange Juice
Description: Sweet citrus body; adds softness, can dilute tension if overused.

Name: Pineapple
Description: Tropical fruit with sweetness and mild acidity

Name: Pineapple Juice
Description: Tropical sweetness + aroma; creates instant vacation vibe.

Name: Basil
Description: Green, sweet-savory herb; modern freshness with subtle spice.

Name: Cinnamon
Description: Warm baking spice; reinforces comfort and dessert associations.

Name: Ginger
Description: Spicy heat + aroma; creates immediate energy and tension.

Name: Mint
Description: Cooling aromatic herb; boosts perceived freshness and lift.

Name: Rosemary
Description: Piney, resinous herb; adds serious aromatic structure.

Name: Black Tea
Description: Firm tannins; adds dryness and structure like a non-alcoholic backbone.

Name: Cold Brew Coffee
Description: Low-acid coffee depth; adds roast bitterness and adult sweetness illusion.

Name: Green Tea
Description: Fresh, grassy tannins; adds restrained bitterness and clarity.

Name: Matcha
Description: Umami-green intensity; striking color and polarizing bitterness.

Name: Oolong Tea
Description: Floral-roasty complexity; bridges light and dark profiles.
